message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CE, cs.CR, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a method for making risk mitigating recommendations using longitudinal data and inverse classification. This involves using past outcome probabilities as features in the present and updating unchangeable features using values from the next longitudinal time period. This approach is relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computational engineering (cs.CE), cryptography and security (cs.CR), and social and information networks (cs.SI).
